original_title: Bacterial pneumonia outbreak sickens dozens in large urban area | Fox News
article_summary: "New York City faces an outbreak of Legionnaires' disease, a type of bacterial pneumonia, with 108 confirmed cases and 5 deaths reported. The disease is usually found in freshwater environments but can spread indoors via water systems. Symptoms include flu-like symptoms and respiratory problems, and it's not typically spread person-to-person. Those at higher risk, such as the elderly, smokers, and those with chronic lung conditions, should seek medical attention immediately."</s>
